thread.title: High School Roundup: Shikellamy boys soccer closing in on playoff berth
thread.title_full: High School Roundup: Shikellamy boys soccer closing in on playoff berth

author: The Daily Item
title: High School Roundup: Shikellamy boys soccer closing in on playoff berth
text:
High School Roundup: Shikellamy boys soccer closing in on playoff berth By The   
BOYS SOCCER 
SUNBURY — Junior striker/midfielder Anthony Velasquez stepped up Monday when it mattered the most for Shikellamy in its last home game of the year. 
Thanks to a three-goal day by Velasquez, Shikellamy is within one game of the District 4 playoffs after the Braves drubbed Shamokin, 6-1, in a Heartland-I contest. 
Velasquez scored off a Joe Davila assist to tie the game at 1 for Shikellamy (8-8, 7-5 HAC-I) midway through the first half. 
But in the second half, Velasquez scored twice in the opening two minutes to give the Braves control of the game. Tyler Balliet and Davila and Brendan Stepp added goals later in the second half. 
“I’m proud of the guys for starting off well. We are just trying to make our way into the postseason this week,” said Shikellamy coach Jon Steese. 
Shikellamy has two games remaining this year: at Mifflinburg on Wednesday and at Shamokin on Thursday. The Braves need to win one of the contests to reach the postseason. 
Lewisburg 12, 
Hughesville 0 
HUGHESVILLE — Joey Bhangdia and Zach Kratzer scored four goals apiece to lead the Green Dragons to the HAC-II victory. 
Tommy Bhangdia, plus Andre Permyashkin, Nate Liscum and Griffin Hancock tallied the other goals for Lewisburg (17-0, 15-0 HAC-II), which also got three assists from Joey Bhangdia. 
Mifflinburg 0, 
Central Mountain 0 (OT) 
MILL HALL — Ben Greb made four saves in goal to keep Mifflinburg in the game with Central Mountain and preserve the tie in HAC-I action. Mifflinburg moves to 9-5-3, 5-5-3 in league play. 
Central Columbia 2, 
Warrior Run 1 (OT) 
ALMEDIA — The Blue Jays’ Matt Yoder scored with three minutes left in the second overtime to hand the Defenders a loss in HAC-II action. 
Warrior Run (10-7 overall) forced overtime with a goal by Cody Rogers, who scored off an assist by Collin Walburn. 
Nick Brunozzi scored in the first half to give Central the lead. 
GIRLS SOCCER 
Midd-West 6, 
Mifflinburg 0 
MIFFLINBURG — Brianna and Kelli Beiler had a hand in scoring all but one of the Mustangs’ goals, leading them to the HAC-II victory. 
Brianna Beiler scored the first goal of the game for Midd-West (13-2-1, 11-2-1 HAC-II), while Kelli Beiler also scored in the first half to give the Mustangs a 4-0 halftime lead. In between, both girls assisted on goals from Makenzi Kauffman and Shayla Heckman. 
In the second half, Kauffman scored again, this time off an assist by Kelli Beiler, and Brittany Smith later completed the scoring for Midd-West. 
ACAA Play-in Game 
Sunbury Christian 1, 
Juniata Menn. 1 (OT) 
NORTHUMBERLAND — After the game remained tied following regulation and overtime, the crucial contest was decided by penalty kicks from Emma Atwood, Brianna Baumert and Marissa Spangler that sent the Eagles into the ACAA tournament. 
Brooke Snyder scored off a Spangler assist to tie the game with 5:54 left in the first half for Sunbury Christian (11-7, 6-5 ACAA), which will host Calvary Christian Academy in a first-round game on Thursday at 11 a.m. 
Meadowbrook Chr. 9, 
Walnut Street Chr. 0 
MILTON — Katie Benfer scored four times and had an assist in the first half to lead the Lions into the ACAA tournament. 
Shanae Bomberger added two goals and an assist, plus Jackie Stokes had a goal and two assists in the second half for Meadowbrook (15-2, 9-1 ACAA), which will get the No. 2 seed in the East for the tournament that begins Thursday at Sunbury Christian. 
Mount Carmel 3, 
Shamokin 0 
COAL TOWNSHIP — A pair of second-half goals by Maci Mazzatesta helped blow the game open for the Red Tornadoes in the HAC crossover game. Nicole Varano scored in the first half for Mount Carmel (13-4). 
Line Mountain 2, 
Tri-Valley 1 
HEGINS — Breanna Ebright and Meadow Walshaw-Wertz both scored late goals in the first half to lead the Eagles to the Tri-Valley League win. Both goals were unassisted for Line Mountain. 
FIELD HOCKEY 
Susquenita 0 
MILLERSTOWN — The Wildcats ended Tri-Valley League play with a convincing shutout win over the Blackhawks. 
Paityn Wirth had a hat trick for Greenwood (15-2, 10-0 TVL), while the other usual suspects — Courtney Fleisher, Morgan Kauffman and Mallory Fortenbaugh — tallied the other goals for the Wildcats. 
GIRLS TENNIS 
District 4 Doubles 
SOUTH WILLIAMSPORT — Hughesville’s top-ranked doubles team of Rachel Thomas and Allison Mattucci took a 6-3, 6-0 win over Bloomsburg’s third-ranked duo of Molly Williams and Lauren Cunfer to claim the District 4 title at the West Branch Racquet Club. 
In the semis, Thomas and Mattucci defeated Bloomsburg’s fourth-ranked team of Emily Wawroski and Kaitlin Karaffa, 6-0, 6-1; while Williams and Cunfer beat South Williamsport’s No. 2-ranked team of Hannah Summerson and Megan Rovenolt, 3-6, 6-4, 7-6. 
X-COUNTRY 
Danville boys/girls finish season on high note 
DANVILLE — First-place finishes by Joe Malafronte (17:42) and Mackenzie Jones (20:29) led to a pair of convincing wins for the Ironmen over Loyalsock in a season-ending meet.
